long: Meaning: properly, "iteration" or "continuance"; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), "again", "repeatedly", "still", "more".  Usage: again, × all life long, at all, besides, but, else, further(-more), henceforth, (any) longer, (any) more(-over), × once, since, (be) still, when, (good, the) while (having being), (as, because, whether, while) yet (within).  Source: or "עֹד"; from "H5749";
